key_insight: DuaDeep-SeqAffinity predicts antigen–antibody binding affinity directly from amino acid sequences using a dual-stream hybrid deep network, eliminating dependence on scarce 3D structural data.
problem_solved: Reduces the need for experimentally determined or computationally derived 3D structures for affinity prediction, enabling faster, scalable screening and design from sequence-only inputs.
method: Dual-stream encoding: separate sequence encoders for antigen and antibody that extract complementary sequence-level features.
Cross-stream fusion: a hybrid fusion module (e.g., cross-attention/interaction layers) integrates encoded representations to model pairwise interaction signals.
End-to-end regression: a downstream head maps fused features to a continuous affinity score; training uses affinity-labeled sequence datasets with augmentation and regularization.
impact: Enables rapid, structure-free affinity estimation useful for high-throughput antibody screening, lead prioritization, and sequence-driven design workflows — lowering experimental cost and accelerating ML-driven discovery.
visual_elements: Schematic of the dual-stream model: two sequence encoders (antigen, antibody) feeding a fusion module and regression head.
Pipeline flowchart: raw sequences → encoding → fusion → predicted affinity score (with example inputs/outputs).
Performance chart: predicted vs measured affinity scatterplot (or bar chart vs baseline methods) to convey accuracy gains.
Residue-level attention heatmap or importance map over paired sequences to illustrate interpretable interaction hotspots.
paper_title: DuaDeep-SeqAffinity: Dual-Stream Deep Learning Framework for Sequence-Only Antigen-Antibody Affinity Prediction
paper_authors: Aicha Boutorh, Soumia Bouyahiaoui, Sara Belhadj, Nour El Yakine Guendouz, Manel Kara Laouar
